Thesequestions, together with the future of the RB 211 contract, will requireclose and continuous supervision by the Government for some time to come.I have asked the Secretary of State for Defence to take charge of thiscomplex of issues and, together with the Secretary of State for Employment,the Secretary of State for Trade and Industry, the Minister of AviationSupply, the Chief Secretary, Treasury and the Attorney-General, to ensurethe necessary co-ordination of action across the board. Other ministers will be brought into consultation as necessaryj and the Secretary of Statefor Defence will report as necessary to the Cabinet. The ministerial group will be supported by an official team under Cabinet Officecha ir man sh ip.E H10 Downing Street SW15 February 1971
